class="datasetDescription">The Working Timetable, published for the use of the rail industry, shows all train movements on the network including empty trains and those coming in and out of depots. It includes identification codes for each train and intermediate times for journeys, including the time at stations at which a train is not scheduled to stop. <br /><br />It is not to be confused with the Electronic National Rail Timetable which is intended for passengers. <br /><br />To plan a journey, please refer to the <a title="Electronic National Rail Timetable" href="/aspx/3828.aspx">Electronic National Rail Timetable</a> or visit <a title="National Rail Enquiries" href="http://www.nationalrail.co.uk/" target="_blank">National Rail Enquiries</a>.</div><div class="keywords">WTT</div><div class="clear"> </div><div class="moreInformationContainer"><div class="moreInformationDataColumns relatedDownload"><span class="informationHeaders">RELATED LINKS</span><ul><li><a title="Working timetable" href="/browseDirectory.aspx?dir=\Timetables\Working Timetable (WTT)&root=\Timetables\Working Timetable (WTT)">Working timetable</a></li></ul></div></div><div class="shareWithSocialMedia"><a href="javascript:shareWithSocialMedia('twitter')" title="Share with twitter" class="twitter"> </a><a href="javascript:shareWithSocialMedia('facebook')" title="Share with facebook" class="facebook"> </a><a href="javascript:shareWithSocialMedia()" title="Email this" class="email"> </a></div></div></div></div>

name: network-rail-transparency
notes:
Explore our information and data below. You’ll find data sets we’re publishing for the first time and links which make pre-existing content easier to find. Under the terms of use of our website www.networkrail.co.uk, please acknowledge and attribute Network Rail (and that of any identified contributors) as the authors of material.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

  • Quarterly summaries of footfall at our managed stations can be found under 'S' Station footfall. The footfall data captures the numbers of people entering and exiting our stations (including Leeds).
  • Data Feeds is intended for developers, feeds from the operational systems report what's happening on the railway minute-by-minute.
title: Network Rail Transparency
